c74object.name: the.circadian
c74object.digest: Automate parameters along a core timeline provided by the.jit.thalamus
c74object.description:
Written by Tim Heinze © 2020, www.xenorama.com.
Outputs frame-based or normalised timeline progression during realtime playback or offline rendering to support the approximation of a sequencer.
Connect this object to any parameter you wish to automate via mapping objects of choice, like functon, mc.evolve, table, funbuff, etc.

objarg.name: render-context
objarg.digest: Specify a named render context for all children objects to sync to.
objarg.description: For convenience, this can be identical to one's world render context name but is to be considered independent. It is necessary to provide a context name for all members of the offline render family to sync and respond to.

attribute.name: exportname
attribute.digest: Specify a unique name to write to
attribute.description: Specify a unique name to export to after completion of the capturing process, managed by the.jit.thalamus. The resulting filetype is JSON and can be re-exported/imported using the export and import messages, respectively.

attribute.name: active
attribute.description:
Set the active flag. There are 4 active states available suitable for different purposes:
0 = ignore this object and pass everything through without recording or recalling
1 = operate normally (default); playback, record and output during rendering
2 = playback and output previously recorded data normally but do not record any new data
3 = playback and record normally but do not output data during rendering
4 = record and output during rendering but never pass incoming data
5 = mute all activity
Note that while recording is disabled, the automatic export upon recording completion (if an exportname is specified) is also disabled and previous files will not be overwritten.

method.name: bang
method.digest: Send dictionary data out right outlet
method.description: Sending a bang to the left inlet of mtr, results in a dictionary being sent out the right outlet with information about the current state of the object. Both global and track specific informtion is included in the dictionary. An entry that begins with "global_" is the global setting for the specified attribute. If the same attribute has a track specific setting, that value will be listed under the track information.

method.name: anything
method.digest: Store the message on the timeline
method.description: The internal mtr object can store any type of data it receives—other than matrices or signals—including complex lists. Although mtr can record individual bytes of MIDI messages received from midiin, it stores each byte with a separate delta time, and does not format the MIDI messages the way seq does. If you want to record complete MIDI messages and edit them later, seq is better suited for the task. On the other hand, mtr is perfectly suited for recording sequences of numbers, lists, or symbols from virtually any object in Max: specialized MIDI objects such as notein or pgmin, user interface objects such as number box, slider, and dial, or any other object.

method.name: preview
method.description: Output the corresponding fft frame at the normalised position while not rendering by jit.world.

method.name: export
method.description:
If an exportname has previously been specified, the JSON-file will be written to the dir as specified by the.jit.thalamus.
If an optional argument is provided (symbol), a JSON-file with this name will be written to disk.

method.name: import
method.description:
If an exportname has previously been specified, the JSON-file will be read from the dir as specified by the.jit.thalamus.
If an optional argument is provided (symbol), it will be attempted to read a JSON-file with this name from disk.
